isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - FUEL SYSTEM - Installation - Priming the Fuel System

svcsubproc.title: Priming without Vacuum Source

note.para: If the fuel system will not prime during diagnosis, the engine will exhibit white to black smoke and pulsating fuel pressure. See Combustion Leaks to Fuel in Section 4 of Engine Diagnostics Manual EGES-240.

svcsubproc.para: If the engine is out of fuel, do the following steps:

step1.para: Add fuel to tank. If equipped with dual tanks, add fuel to passenger side tank. Check fuel level in operator side tank to verify transfer pump is operating correctly.
Remove fuel filter cap using a band wrench. Leave filter in housing.
Fill fuel filter housing with diesel fuel up to the filter cap threads.
Replace fuel filter cap and tighten.
Engage starter for 30 seconds and allow starter to cool for two minutes.

note.para: Return ignition key to RUN only between starts to decrease load on batteries. This will prevent glow plugs from recycling.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the starter, if engine fails to start within 30 seconds, release ignition switch and wait 2 to 3 minutes to allow starter motor to cool. Repeat above procedure.

step1.para: Repeat step 5 until engine starts and runs on its own.

item.para: Three to five cranking periods will be required to start vehicle. Additional cranking periods may be required if fuel filter is not primed.

note.para: Engines in bus applications require more cranking time, since the rear tank is farther from the engine.

If the fuel system will not prime during diagnosis, the engine will exhibit white to black smoke and pulsating fuel pressure. See Combustion Leaks to Fuel in Section 4 of Engine Diagnostics Manual EGES-240.

step1.para: Add fuel to tank. If equipped with dual tanks, add fuel to passenger side tank. Check fuel level in operator side tank to verify transfer pump is operating correctly.
Install fuel pressure test fitting in unfiltered fuel test port.
Attach vacuum source to fuel pressure test coupling and connect to fuel pressure test fitting.
Draw fuel from tank using vacuum source until level in fuel filter housing reaches fitting.
Disconnect vacuum source and fuel pressure test coupler from fuel pressure test fitting.
Engage starter for 30 seconds and allow starter to cool for two minutes.

note.para: Return ignition key to RUN only between starts to decrease load on batteries. This will prevent glow plugs from recycling.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the starter, if engine fails to start within 30 seconds, release ignition switch and wait 2 to 3 minutes to allow starter motor to cool. Repeat above procedure.

step1.para: Repeat step 6 until engine starts and runs on its own.

item.para: Three to five cranking periods will be required to start vehicle. Additional cranking periods may be required if fuel filter is not primed.

step1.para: After engine has been started and is running smoothly, stop engine and remove fuel pressure test fitting and reinstall plug in filter housing.
